alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 6:28PM EDT until July 28 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Montgomery County in central Maryland... Eastern Loudoun County in northern Virginia... The northwestern City of Fairfax in northern Virginia... Northwestern Arlington County in northern Virginia... The northwestern City of Falls Church in northern Virginia... Northern Fairfax County in northern Virginia... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 628 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Great Falls, or near Lowes Island, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Rockville, Bethesda, Reston, Herndon, Fairfax, Vienna, Falls Church, Lowes Island, Pimmit Hills, American Legion Bridge, Mclean, Aspen Hill, Potomac, North Bethesda, Oakton, Sterling, Chantilly, Tysons Corner, Wolf Trap and Great Falls. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
